ovdesc.p: When REROUTE is specified for a Message, this table is used by the Outward Message Formatting module to replace the original carrier.

The Disposition field in the Message Header may be set to REROUTE using Message Management, or the Disposition Control Table may be used to set a condition on which to 'Reroute' all Messages where that condition applies.

desc.p: Specifies the ID of the Company, Customer or Account that is to be rerouted.
When the ID is a Customer or Account number it is prefixed with the appropriate Company Code when building the key of this file.
The entire key may be input if desired, otherwise the Company code used will be from the user sign on.
When routing messages the Company Code used is 'CUS COMPANY' (from the Message header) for a Customer level ID, and 'COMPANY' for other IDs.

When a Message is to be 'Rerouted' this file is searched for a record providing a replacement for the Carrier Addr-No, Language, Format and Copies parameters that would otherwise be taken from the DE.PRODUCT file. The original Language, Format and Copies will be unchanged if they are not on the alternate file.
Only a record at the same level as the Product record will be accessed. Therefore, if Product routing was at customer level, the ALTERNATE table will be accessed at customer level.
a) Either a Company code or 'C-'followed by a Customer number or 'A-'followed by an Account number b) '.' c) The carrier, e.g. PRINT, SWIFT, TELEX d) '.' e) 1-3 numeric characters (Mandatory input.)
The carrier must reference a carrier defined on the carrier definition file, DE.CARRIER.
The carrier module, as defined in the field CARRIER.MODULE on the DE.CARRIER record, must be in the list of outward carriers on DE.PARM.
Defines the Language to be used for printed messages. If not entered the Language on the message Header will remain unchanged.
If the alternate carrier is Print, then Language is required in order to select the appropriate record from the Format Print table.
1-2 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input) If entered it must be a valid Language mnemonic. Must be blank if alternate carrier is EUCLID.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 9 characters may be entered.
Specifies a new Carrier and Address Number to replace the usual one obtained from the delivery Product file.
a) The carrier, e.g. SWIFT, PRINT, TELEX (Mandatory input.) b) '.' c) 1-3 numeric character Address Version Number as in the ID of the Address file. (Optional input, default value '.1')
Carrier must reference a record on the carrier definition file, DE.CARRIER.

A record must exist on the DE.ADDRESS file, with a key composed of: - the customer or company code in the ID of this record - the address field from the carrier record (DE.CARRIER) - the address number field from this field e.g. If the ID of the record is US0010001.C-100001.PRINT.1 and this field contains TELEXF.1, the carrier record for TELEXF is accessed initially to find out the addresses used for TELEXF. So, if the ADDRESS field for TELEXF is TELEX, a record must exist on DE.ADDRESS with a key of US0010001.C-100001.TELEX.1.
The carrier module, as defined in the field CARRIER.MODULE on the DE.CARRIER record, must be in the list of outward carriers on DE.PARM.
Specifies the number of copies of a message to be generated. If not entered the value on the message Header will be unchanged.
1-2 numeric characters. (Optional input) Must be blank if alternate carrier is EUCLID.
Specifies the Format version to be used when reading the DE.FORMAT.PRINT file. If not entered, the value on the message header will be retained.
1-3 numeric characters. (Optional input) If entered for alternate carrier of SWIFT, TELEXF or TELEX, must be 1. Must be blank if alternate carrier is EUCLID.
